text: don't like get me wrong... I am not a fan of MatLab - but this makes it pretty appealing: <https://www.mathworks.com/products/matlab-coder.html>

elements.text: don't like get me wrong... I am not a fan of MatLab - but this makes it pretty appealing:

text: Does it work for any MatLab code? Also when they say portable does it mean that there are no shared library dependencies?

elements.text: Does it work for any MatLab code? Also when they say portable does it mean that there are no shared library dependencies?

text: 1. I don't know. 2. I believe that is the case?

elements.text: I don't know. 2. I believe that is the case?
That's pretty cool anyways

text: It is pretty cool. What's probably cooler in my opinion is how close Julia is to basically having this without the need to go to C++, just static compile and poof FFI via whatever language you want

elements.text: It is pretty cool. What's probably cooler in my opinion is how close Julia is to basically having this without the need to go to C++, just static compile and poof FFI via whatever language you want

text: it's pretty impressive mostly considering how unwieldy I found matlab coding

elements.text: it's pretty impressive mostly considering how unwieldy I found matlab coding

text: like they really made something out of that bowl of spaghetti :spaghetti:

elements.text: like they really made something out of that bowl of spaghetti

text: I've used this, and it's kind of weird. Not all of it is a one-to-one mapping.

elements.text: I've used this, and it's kind of weird. Not all of it is a one-to-one mapping.

text: Matlab coder was a big reason I moved to Julia. It does *not* work for all matlab code. I had to maintain two versions of the matlab code, one that worked for code generation and one that wasn't terribly extremely slow when run in matlab.

elements.text: Matlab coder was a big reason I moved to Julia. It does
not
work for all matlab code. I had to maintain two versions of the matlab code, one that worked for code generation and one that wasn't terribly extremely slow when run in matlab.

text: It's particularly nice for prototyping on embedded hardware. My team at work relies heavily on it.

elements.text: It's particularly nice for prototyping on embedded hardware. My team at work relies heavily on it.

text:
It is widely used in industry. It is the MathWorks solution to embed MATLAB in production code. It is not perfect yet it is getting better and better. It doesn't cover all functions but it is a really small minority which is not covered.
One nice thing is it can generate a portable Deep Learning code (No library needed). Also its generated CUDA code for DNN is very efficient (The speed is faster than PyTorch in many cases.

elements.text:
It is widely used in industry. It is the MathWorks solution to embed MATLAB in production code. It is not perfect yet it is getting better and better. It doesn't cover all functions but it is a really small minority which is not covered.
One nice thing is it can generate a portable Deep Learning code (No library needed). Also its generated CUDA code for DNN is very efficient (The speed is faster than PyTorch in many cases.

text: I was mentioning it years ago to <@U6795JH6H>. Once Julia can generate easily embeddable and portable DLL / Static Libraries it can kill this market.

elements.text: I was mentioning it years ago to
. Once Julia can generate easily embeddable and portable DLL / Static Libraries it can kill this market.

text: sounds to me like the bar is pretty low tbh. Also I recently took a look at Symblics.jl and ModellingToolkit... Julia is really close to a stand in place replacement to MatLab's ecosystem in the not super far away future

elements.text: sounds to me like the bar is pretty low tbh. Also I recently took a look at Symblics.jl and ModellingToolkit... Julia is really close to a stand in place replacement to MatLab's ecosystem in the not super far away future

text: I agree. MATLAB Coder isn't an engineering pinnacle. Once Julia is able to generate Static / Dynamic Library it will be a better solution with better performance than MATLAB Coder.

elements.text: I agree. MATLAB Coder isn't an engineering pinnacle. Once Julia is able to generate Static / Dynamic Library it will be a better solution with better performance than MATLAB Coder.

text: I have used Matlab coder in the past to deploy Matlab code but it was 100% to avoid needing a license to deploy in the cloud, so Julia has always solved the problem I needed if for

text: I guess the other problem it can be used to solve is code obfuscation

text: I always got that product confused with MATLAB Compiler, which is actually far less interesting: <https://www.mathworks.com/products/compiler.html>

attachments.title: MATLAB Compiler
attachments.text: MATLAB Compiler lets you share MATLAB programs as standalone, MapReduce, and Spark applications; web apps; and Microsoft Excel add-ins.
